result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A. Young

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  (Court Reporter: P. Delaney) Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI is waived by parties and sentencing arguments made.  Deft. is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 100 days.  Deft. is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: PT
Atty Perz states DE's revocation hearing is set for next Tuesday and requests a plea hearing after that date; no objection by the State.  Plea Hearing on 1/14/15 at 8:30 AM.
Final pre-trial on December 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Due to a continued Jury Trial; FPT rescheduled to 12/12/14 at 9:30 AM per confirmation from Atty Perz.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Exhibits 1 & 2 Inventoried and stored in Br 1 Exhibit Room on 10-15-14 - NSJ
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Perz. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Matt Perz. Clerk LE. Jennifer A. of the DOC Sex Offender Registry Program sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Perz. Probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Perz. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 10-28-14 @ 9:30am.  Bond continued.

1:45 pm    Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matt Perz.  Clerk:  LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on 10-14-14 @ 10:15 am.  $5000 cash bond set with conditions.

Comply w/ sex offender registry requirements.
301.45(4)(a) Sex Offender - Fail/Update Info, Repeater
